citeinfo.title: The StreamCat Dataset: Accumulated Attributes for NHDPlusV2 Catchments (Version 2.1) for the Conterminous United States: EnviroAtlas Nitrogen Inputs

pubinfo.publish: US EPA Office of Research & Development (ORD) - National Health and Environmental Effects Research Laboratory (NHEERL)

descript.abstract:
This dataset represents the application of nitrogen within individual local NHDPlusV2 catchments and upstream, contributing watersheds based on the EnviroAtlas (See Supplementary Info for Glossary of Terms).
These data are based on county-scale estimates of N in the form of fertilizer, manure, or cultivated biological nitrogen fixation. The rasters used for this analysis were prepared by EnviroAtlas but not distributed. Links to data in each raster can be found in Data Sources below.
The nitrogen characteristics (kg N/ha/yr) were summarized to produce local catchment-level and watershed-level metrics as a continuous data type (see Data Structure and Attribute Information for a description).
descript.purpose: These data were created in support of the US EPAâ€™s National Aquatic Resource Survey (NARS) and Safe and Sustainable Waters Resources (SSWR) Programs. However, these watershed summaries of landscape data have broad applicability for hydrological, geomorphic, or ecological modeling, management, and restoration. For details on EPA NARS and SSWR Programs see http://water.epa.gov/type/watersheds/monitoring/aquaticsurvey_index.cfm and http://www.epa.gov/research/progressreport/water.htm
descript.supplinf:
All code and scripts used to produce these data were written in the python or R programming languages and are freely available at: ftp://newftp.epa.gov/EPADataCommons/ORD/NHDPlusLandscapeAttributes/StreamCat/Documentation/Code/ or https://github.com/USEPA/StreamCat
Glossary of Terms
Stream Segment: NHD line describing a section of contiguous stream or river between upstream and downstream tributaries (as depicted in USGS topographic quadrangles), except where the segment is a headwater or terminal stream (e.g., an outlet to the ocean).
Catchment (Cat): The portion of the landscape where surface flow drains directly to an NHD stream segment, excluding any upstream contributions.
Watershed (Ws): The set of hydrologically-connected catchments, consisting of all upstream catchments that contribute flow to any local catchment.
COMID: Unique identifier for each stream segment, and associated catchment, in NHDPlusV2. Watershed metrics describe entire area of all catchments that accumulate to the specific catchment based on the NHD PlusFlow table.
Riparian Buffer (RipBuf): Spatial buffer of 100-m that was added to NHDPlusV2 stream network and NLCD water pixels. The buffers were used to spatially constrain calculations for some landscape metrics to within 100 meters of the riparian area.
Landscape Layer: Any geospatial layer from which we derived statistical summaries for both local catchments and watersheds. These landscape layers were comprised of several GIS formats, including vector (points, lines, or polygons) and raster.

idinfo.useconst: None. While EPA has used its best efforts to include complete and accurate information in the EME, EPA cannot be held responsible for errors or omissions and is not liable for any direct, indirect or consequential damages resulting from using this information. procstep.procdesc: Dataset downloaded from https://edg.epa.gov/data/Public/ORD/EnviroAtlas/ Data source, date, units and resolution were recorded in a project tracking spreadsheet and verified. ftp://newftp.epa.gov/EPADataCommons/ORD/NHDPlusLandscapeAttributes/StreamCat/Documentation/DataDictionary.html
Projection of dataset verified as USGS Albers Equal Area Conic and projected if necessary

Performed a visual inspection of dataset for gaps, edges other anomalous features. Verified how no-data values were represented and recoded values as no-data where appropriate (for instance, if no-data locations represented by 0's or -9999, these were converted to no-data values). Data manipulation documented in Pre-Processing script (StreamCat_PreProcessing.py)

Ran zonal statistics python script (StreamCat.py) to calculate zonal statistics for all NHDPlusV2 catchments in each NHDPlusV2 Vector Processing Unit (VPU). Zonal statistics were perofrmed using either ZonalStatisticsAsTable, TabulateArea, or spatially joining vector point data to catchments. Each method applies to the type of landscape layer being evaluated, Continuous, Categorical, or Point. We also calculated the percent of each catchment that had coverage by a given landscape layer (i.e. was not null). These results are accumulated using the NHDPlusV2 flow table to summarize upstream catchment values and complete watershed values for the metric.

Clean and standardize results of zonal statistics table from accumulation script / process using makeFinalTables.py. Clean up consisted of calculating mean value of metric per zone, renaming and sorting zonal statistics fields, and writing zonal results to .csv file.

attr.attrdef: Unique ID label to each catchment in NHDPlusV2
Area of local catchment measured in square kilometers.
% of the catchment that is covered by the landscape raster.
Area of the local catchment and accumulated upstream catchments composing the entire watershed (Ws) measured in square kilometers.
% of the watershed that is covered by the landscape raster.
Mean rate of synthetic nitrogen fertilizer application in kg N/ha/yr within the local catchment (Cat)
Mean rate of manure application from confined animal feeding operations in kg N/ha/yr within the local catchment (Cat)
Mean rate of biological nitrogen fixation from the cultivation of crops in kg N/ha/yr within the local catchment (Cat)
Mean rate of synthetic nitrogen fertilizer application in kg N/ha/yr within the total upstream watershed (Ws)
Mean rate of manure application from confined animal feeding operations in kg N/ha/yr within the total upstream watershed (Ws)
Mean rate of biological nitrogen fixation from the cultivation of crops in kg N/ha/yr within the total upstream watershed (Ws)
